item.title: Report E-2024120160
item.description:
Report E-2024120160

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-10T12:24:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-16
  • City: CASTLETON
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While unloading freight from trailer it was discovered that two pails on a pallet of 16 were leaking from the top. Further investigation revealed that it appeared that freight loaded on top of the pails by the shipper had crushed two of the pail closures damaging them contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as were the damaged pails.

item.title: Report E-2024120066
item.description:
Report E-2024120066

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-06T12:24:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-04
  • City: MONTGOMERY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XNW experienced a UN2920 Dicoco Dimethyl Ammonium Chloride release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 4 ounces of product released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the poly tote lid due to a loose cap. The cap was tightened and re-secured onto the tote. The tote was then decontaminated, wiped down, and secured for continued shipment on. The impacted pads used to clean the tote were containerized into a 5-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024120378
item.description:
Report X-2024120378

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-06T12:24:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-25
  • City: POTSDAM
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THE ACCEPTANCE AUDITOR WAS CHECKING SUSPISCIOUS PKGS COMING DOWN THE BELT, WHEN THEY CAME ACCROSS THIS PKG AND ANOTHER WITH THE SAME MARKINGS TO TWO DIFFERENT LOCATIONS. THE PKG WAS STOPPED TO BE AUDITED, AND THE HAZMAT SUPPORT CENTER HAD US OPEN THE PKG TO CHECK THE CONTENTS. WHEN WE DID SO THE SIX POWER BANKS WERE DISCOVERED AND THE PKG WAS HALTED. REWRAP; NO DAMAGE

item.title: Report X-2024120337
item.description:
Report X-2024120337

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-06T12:24:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-07
  • City: PLATTSBURGH
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: GENERATOR WAS UNLOADED BY AN UNLOADER, NOTCIED IT WAS HEAVY. TUG GUY OPENED GAS CAP COVER TO CHECK IF IT WAS FULL. NOTICED HE COULD SEE GASOLINE STILL INSIDE OF GENERATOR. GENREATOR WAS REMOVED FROM SORT. TUG GUY NOTIFIED IMMDIATE SUPERVISOR, SUPERVISOR SENT OUT EMAIL INQUIRING ABOUT UNDECLARED HAZARDOUS SHIPMENT. SHIPMENT BROUGHT AND STORED IN DMP AREA. HAZMAT HELP DESK CALLED NEXT DAY TO DECLARE THAT WE HAVE STOPPED AN UNDECLARED HAZARDOUS MATERIALS SHIPMENT.
